subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Monday, May 14, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Reid backs two separate Iraq bills

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- With the political ball back in his
court, the top Democrat in the Senate offered two Iraq
proposals Monday, including one which does not contain timeline
requirements for the withdrawal of U.S. troops.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/reid-backs-two-separate-iraq-bills.html

***

Bush v. greenhouse gases

WASHINGTON (AP) -- President Bush responded to a Supreme
Court environmental ruling by settling on regulatory changes
that don't need congressional approval, the White House said
Monday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/president-clinton-stumps-for-wife.html

***

Spitzer endorses Clinton, New Jersey mayors lend
support to Obama

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- New York
Gov. Eliot Spitzer formally endorsed Sen. Hillary Clinton's
presidential bid Monday, calling the New York Democrat someone
who has "proven herself time and again."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/spitzer-endorses-clinton-new-jersey.html

***

President Clinton stumps for wife
online

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former President
Bill Clinton touts his wife's biography in a new Web video
designed to help boost her bid for the White House.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/president-clinton-stumps-for-wife.html

***

Club for Growth gives Giuliani good
assessment

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Former New
York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani received a positive review Monday
from the Club for Growth, a fiscally conservative political
action committee best known for its anti-tax positions.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/club-for-growth-gives-giuliani-good.html

***

Obama: 'I expect to earn' black vote

TETERBORO, New Jersey (AP) -- Democratic presidential
hopeful Barack Obama said Monday he won't take the black vote
for granted, especially since rival Hillary Rodham Clinton and
her husband, former President Clinton, have established strong
ties with the community.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-i-expect-to-earn-black-vote.html

***

New Yorkers give nod to Bloomberg in match up with
Giuliani

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- New York City
Mayor Michael Bloomberg has said he has no plans to run for
president in 2008, but New Yorkers overwhelmingly believe he
would make a better president than his predecessor, GOP
presidential hopeful Rudy Giuliani.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/new-yorkers-give-nod-to-bloomberg-in.html

***

Majority of Americans do not favor military
action against Iran

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- A new
CNN/Opinion Research Corporation Poll released Monday shows a
majority of Americans oppose any military action against Iran
and a large portion of Americans believe Iran is an enemy.


Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/majority-of-americans-do-not-favor.html

***

Gingrich: 'Great possibility' I'll get in
race

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Former House Speaker
Newt Gingrich said Monday there is a very good chance he'll get
into the race for the 2008 Republican presidential nomination,
but he won't decide until after September.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/gingrich-great-possibility-ill-get-in.html

***

Clinton to begin text-messaging
supporters

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Supporters of
Sen. Hillary Clinton have a new way to stay on top of the
latest news from her presidential campaign.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/clinton-to-begin-text-messaging.html

***

McCain highlights mother's age on Mother's
Day

ATLANTA (CNN) -- So what does a
70-year-old presidential candidate facing questions about his
age do on Mother's Day?

Why, he shows off his
95-year-old mom, of course.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/mccain-highlights-mothers-age-on.html
